About the company:




VakilSearch is a technology-driven platform, offering services that cover the legal needs of startups and established businesses. Some of our services include incorporation, government registrations & filings, accounting, documentation and annual compliances. In addition, we offer a wide range of services to individuals, such as property agreements and tax filings. Our mission is to provide one-click access to individuals and businesses for all their legal and professional needs.

You can learn more about us at vakilsearch.com.




About the role:

A successful data analyst needs to have a combination of technical as well leadership skills. A background in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Management can serve as a solid foundation to build your career as a data analyst at VakilSearch.

Why to join Vakilsearch:

Unlimited opportunities to grow
Flat hierarchy
Encouraging environment to unleash your out of box thinking skills

Responsibilities:

Preparing reports for the stakeholders and the management, enabling them to take important decisions based on various facts and trends.
Using automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources
Identify and recommend the right product metrics to be analysed and tracked for every feature/problem statement.
Using statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets that could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction
Working with programmers, engineers, and management heads to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies.

Required skills:

Bachelors degree from an accredited university or college in computer science or graduate from data science related program
Minimum of 0 - 2 years experience in analysing

Any experience with analytics tools such as mixpanel, google analytics, amplitude or any past relevant technical experience will be preferred.

Should display highest levels of ownership and adherence to timelines.
High-level written and verbal communication skills.
Knowledge of data visualization software like Tableau and Power BI

Joining Date: Immediate

Experience: 0 - 2 years

Contact: Send your resume to lakshmi@vakilsearch.com with the subject as Applying for Data Analyst

Job description

Futurlytic Private Limited is a new start up organisation located in Bangalore. We work in the field of Data Analytics. We believe that world is moving and trusting towards more social media data in the era of digital transformation. However, the challenge lies how to make these data more useful to solve business problems and transform the data into opportunities. We are working with an eminent US client who is industry leader in translating text into profitable decisions and making state-of-the-art cloud and on-premises text and sentiment analysis technologies that transform customers thoughts and conversations into actionable insights.

Currently we are rapidly expanding our Engineering team in Bangalore to support this growth journey of our client in data Analytics and AI. We are looking for young and dynamic resources who could join and launch their career in cutting edge technologies. Obviously, the compensation is as per industry standard or above standard with suitable skill sets and right academic credential.

We are seeking Data Analyst Professional under product management team. For this position, you should demonstrate strong writing skills, flexibility, and proven experience in writing query on leading edge technologies like text analytics, data analytics, Sentiment Analysis, Dashboard / reporting using Sprinklr platform and so forth. The candidate shall work on query writing and testing doing suitable research on products.

Responsibilities and Duties

Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Ability to learn technical information quickly
Will work on query writing for machine understanding
Willingness to be proactive in seeking information from product management and engineering team
Ability to plan milestones and meet deadlines
An ability to take self-initiative and work with limited direction
Manage update version and release of technical document



Desired Candidate Profile

BE / B. Tech. in Computer Science/ Electronics/Telecommunications or BCA / MCA
Experience: Min 1yr. Smart Fresher can apply.
Work Experiences in Sprinklr platform for Text Analytics and Sentiment analysis
Proficiency in English is compulsory
Candidate should have good knowledge in database query writing skills.
Candidate should have good analytical and issue debugging skills.



Perks and Benefits




Health Insurance, Internet Plan reimbursement, Annual Paid Leave/ Sick Leave

Field1: Graduate Data AnalystPackt Publishing Pvt. Ltd.3.1(75 Reviews)Send me jobs like thisApply
Field3:
Job description

Description

Packtis a global, technical learning publisher with a turnover of 18m and over 400 staff based across the globe, primarily in India and the UK. Principally serving B2C customers across the world, its major clients also include Microsoft, IBM, and Oracle.

We are a leading publisher of technical learning content with the ability to publish books on new and emerging tech faster than any other publisher in the world. Our mission is to increase the shared value of deep tech knowledge. We are tech contentengineers,and we work with some of the most interesting technical minds and ground-breaking creators on the planet.




Role Overview

We are looking for a graduate data analyst to join our PTPN newsletter team. Publishing emails across two cutting-edge domains (security and cloud), our original first-party content is quickly building into a fast-growing audience base. In this role youll work towards building a single source for reporting on newsletter engagement metrics that can be used across multiple customer segments. This will allow us to understand how our content resonates with our subscribers, and how we can better deliver a great subscriber experience.

You will need to be a technically focused individual who has demonstrable interest and experience working with digital marketing datasets. We are rapidly growing startup within Packt and as such we are looking for someone with:

A can do entrepreneurial attitude who is willing to grow and take on new challenges as our business expands, plenty of hustle and active ownership of responsibility from day one.
A flexible approach to working and willingness to step outside of your comfort zone. Were an early stage startup team so your tasks may vary depending on demand and workload.
Willingness to iteratively learn, collaborate and share your learning. A key part of PTPN’s mission within Packt is as a learning hub from the top down!

As one of our first technical hires, you’ll be wearing multiple hats and be collaborating closely with our experienced editorial chiefs to build our growth engine as we scale our further newsletters.




What you’ll do?

You’ll be working with senior members of the PTPN team and other Packt stakeholders to:

Analyse large datasets, identify trends, develop and maintain reports, analyses, dashboards, and other data solutions that educate the team and help make data-driven decisions
Develop a unified system for assessing structured and unstructured datasets across all our current and future newsletter segments
Offer support in building profiles and user personas for cybersecurity and cloud professional user roles for targeted future campaigns
Develop customer surveys and assist the team in making data-driven decisions when building, executing, and analysing survey results
Assist with developing methodologies for segmenting cloud professionals and security professionals based on different user behaviours and patterns.



Who you are?

The work we do is fast paced, demanding, and intellectually challenging. We are looking for dynamic candidates with an interest in technology. You will need strong oral and written communication skills, attention to detail, and excellent organization and time-management skills. You will need to be proactive in troubleshooting and problem-solving, upbeat,enthusiasticand motivated. You will be a demonstrated self-starter who is focused and calm under pressure.




Essentials
Undergraduate degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or Data Science.

Ability to think outside the box and open to working in a start-up-like environment.
Fluent in Python and the Python ecosystem (e.g. pandas, numpy, bokeh, streamlit)
Strong familiarity with Microsoft Excel and Jupyter.



Nice to Have

Previous demonstrable experience of prior work or personal side projects that showcase familiarity with digital marketing datasets, dashboards and reports.
Knowledge of existing email, content analytics and user profiling tools (like Hotjar, Mouseflow etc).




Why work at Packt?

We recognize how important our people are and acknowledge and support the things that are important to them. We focus on the full employee experience. We aim to create a positive working environment that supports personal and collective development – where our people can not only grow their skill sets, continuously challenge themselves, and develop their careers, but also work together as a team and with our customers.




We try to achieve this by:

Ensuring a positive working environment for all employees, supportive of remote work.
Supporting individual development through growth opportunities and internal mobility.
Encouraging social collaboration within teams and communities and knowledge-sharing.
Fostering a culture that supports a healthy work-life balance.



We seek to achieve this by:

Providing a broad range of benefits and initiatives.
Advocating a healthy lifestyle where wellbeing is seen as an essential responsibility.
Celebrating success stories and encouraging peer-to-peer recognition.
Fostering a culture of self-development.
Providing a work environment where the best idea wins, and challenges are encouraged.




Perks and Benefits

You will also have access to a range of flexible benefits that are designed to help you make the most of your time with us.

Bonus scheme
Provision of laptop and other peripherals.
21 days holiday (plus bank holidays)
Pension contribution
Insurance
Flexible hours: choose how, when and where you work.

Collection, validation, analysis of mutual fund information.

Company Profile:
As part of a multibillion-pound equity business owned by HG Capital, FE fundinfo is the leading provider of fund data in the UK and specializes in the collection, validation, dissemination and analysis of fund information within data feeds, documentation, web pages and Internet-based fund selection tools. FE fundinfo is an aggressively growing company, through either sales or acquisitions, with operations currently in the UK, Chennai, Hong Kong, Brno, Singapore, Zurich, Luxembourg and Australia.
Technology is at the center of FE fundinfo and how it delivers investment fund data and advice to global clients. The infrastructure team is the foundation for technical and service delivery, ensuring services for both internal and external customers, ensuring fast, efficient and reliable services. The office in Chennai is the heart of technology for FE fundinfo, with a clear vision to continue to expand and grow, aiming to be one of India's top tech companies in the next 3 years.
FE fundinfo is also engaged in the building of software tools, research centers, document production platforms and advanced analytical products for data vendors, institutions and financial advisers enabling them to retrieve and analyze data in forensic detail.

Field3: Job description             The Role:     In this role Data Analyst, will work on collecting Normalized Profitability Metrics information for Global market companies. This information is obtained from reading and interpreting company disclosures on unusual and non-recurring items that can skew reported earnings. These could include asset impairments and write-off s, gains and losses from currency adjustments and asset and/or business sales etc. which are captured as per the predefined collection policies, You will adhere to local teams goals, policies and procedures and work in a focused manner to achieve the overall organization s goals and objectives. You will be responsible for ensuring and improving the performance, productivity and efficiency and the delivery of the operational performance KPIs. You will effectively manage your performance and development in order to support our continuous operational success.             Responsibilities    :       Establishing and achieving the set SMART goals with the direction of the team lead.      Have a very good understanding of the fundamental data for company s income statement, cash flow statement, balance sheet, and other fundamental data sets.      Participate in the Center of Excellence initiative focused on reducing resource costs, consolidating global data collection platforms, and supporting database integration projects.      Own and Drive continuous improvement within the process through Quality initiatives.        Collecting and analyzing equity fundamentals data for Global market and taking ownership in data quality controls to ensure consistent and high quality data are manufactured in order to meet product requirements.      Manage data as per client-specific requirement, while at the same time adhering to Morningstars set KPIs and KRAs.      Develop a thorough understanding of the various filing nomenclature of countries under coverage.      Passion for data and its impact on decision making.      Closely work with quality assurance and technical department to resolve clients data issues timely and effectively.      Actively discover and raise issues in work (including system, process, and collection methodology) and propose enhancement suggestion to further improve system functionality, process efficiency and data quality.      Participate in other data and process related projects, like industry/market data collection methodology research, market expansion, process certification, new product development support, etc.         Requirements    :       Bachelor s degree in economics/ finance/ business with minimum 60% in final year, Master s degree would be an added advantage. CA Inter/CFA level 1 candidates are also preferred.      0-3 years experience in the financial domain related to equity data.      Strong commerce/finance/accounting fundamentals.      Proficient with the data management policies, procedures and common technical tools.      Ability to exercise control over the executed tasks with the planned activities.      Strong analytical and communication skills.      Good command in MS Office (excel, PowerPoint etc.).      Excellent communication written as well as verbal reporting skill      Prior Knowledge of IFRS GAAP would be an added advantage.      Able to work under tight deadlines and handle pressure during peak seasons. Field3:
Job description



JOB DESCRIPTION

JOB TITLE: Data Analyst




REPORTS TO: Regional Team Leader




LOCATION: Chennai, India




DEPARTMENT: Derivatives Pillar/Data Services/Structured Retail Products




Benefits : Hybrid Working Model, Weekend offs.


JOB PURPOSE




To ensure customer and business data requirements are met through following, establishing, achieving and maintaining data sourcing, entry, output and quality objectives of structured products.

PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES

As part of the SRP data team:


Ensure that the Structured Retail Products database is maintained to exacting standards of quality through the use of bespoke workflow tools and training from domain experts
Target turnaround for updating database should be no longer than 24 hours after system exception notifications or client queries. Appropriate records/reports must be maintained to provide an audit of data changes. Appropriate steps must be made to obtain missing information. Maintain a record of action(s) taken
Ensure that all appropriate data is obtained and processed. Maintain a good record of issues, resolutions, improvements, best practices and demonstrate a procedure for review/updating
Deliver client contract commitments (SLAs) to time, quality and cost, highlighting risks and mitigation strategies accordingly
Ensure all associated projects are performed to agreed deadlines and appropriate records are maintained
Ensure that procedure guides for all data management processes are maintained and are constantly updated with any changes or amendments
Ensure all team tick lists, proformas, logs, etc. are properly maintained
Keep track of trends and pro-actively identify continuous improvement measures
Provide cover during staff absences and peak volumes, as directed by the Team Leader
Engage with other team members, building a high performance and inclusive culture in which talent can thrive
Achieve alignment and understanding to Euromoneys code of conduct and group policies across the team
To work with peers across the team to establish networking links and common areas for collaboration
Undertake projects as directed by the Team Leader
Undertake client investigations as directed by the Team Leader.


KEY INTERFACES


Works with internal staff to ensure cost-effective and efficient data sourcing
Liaises with clients and other third parties to ensure customer service levels are maintained and improved and client issues are effectively dealt with
Liaises with business users of data management systems and productivity applications and collating feedback to ensure all user needs are met
Keeps management informed of operational status through periodic status reporting and project updates.




KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS


Personal Skills Essential:


Good written and verbal communication skills
Good interaction with staff and working with teams - Strong team player
Very good organisational and planning skills
A very high standard of focus, accuracy and attention to detail is essential.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Exemplary high standards of honesty, integrity and endeavour
Ability to use initiative in identifying day to day issues and challenges and recommending appropriate course of action(s).
Basic knowledge and understanding of business terminology
Must be flexible and able to handle multiple tasks
Ability to establish priorities, work independently, and proceed with objectives with minimal supervision
Excellent numeracy
A self-starter who can contribute to the team with minimal supervision
Ability to work under pressure and tight schedules


Personal Skills Desirable:


Ideally, experience gained within a futures & options trading environment or support background.
Previous database administration experience.


Qualifications:


Bachelors Degree in Finance, Business or Mathematics/Statistics
Fluency in English
Understanding of financial markets.



Experience Must Have:


Excellent knowledge of the Internet
Microsoft Office Products (Access, Excel, PowerPoint and Word).



Experience Desirable:



Structured Products knowledge
Data entry in exacting quality centric environment.

Roles and Responsibilities

The main responsibilities of this role are to maintain and update data and manage scheduled work queues. The role, based in the Morningstar Mumbai office, reports directly to the London based Database Team.




Responsibilities are:



To apply all data updates and changes to historical pricing systems
Analysis of historical pricing for correction and to apply missing data points
Update data using MDD UI-based applications
To investigate corporate action changes and apply them accordingly
Update text files using values from websites
To partner with the customer services team to actively resolve any client issues
To ensure all documentation is updated and maintained regularly




Requirements:



Excellent written and oral communication together with excellent interpersonal skills
Sound client service skills with a proactive and creative approach
Good Excel skills for data analysis & transformation.
Demonstrable working knowledge of all Windows operating systems
Bachelors degree or similar qualification in a technical or financial discipline
Demonstrable database experience
Good to have knowledge of SQL server database i.e. ability to run SQL scripts, perform SQL updates
Proven ability to work in a demanding environment managing multiple projects with creative problem-solving skills



Working Time (Approximately):

Day Shift: 08:00 am to 05:00 pm



Notice Period.

Immediate joiner.
30 days prior.

Field3:
Job description

Title: Data Research Analyst, Equity Operations

Team : Fundamentals & Non fundamentals

Shift : Flexible to work in shifts

Shift Timings (Morning) : 5:30 am to 2:30 pm (Pick up provided) / General : 10am to 7pm / Afternoon Shift (UK) : 3pm to 12am( Drop provided) / Night Shift (US) : 8pm to 5am (Drop provided)




How to Apply : Application Link (mandatory)

Candidates need to visit the below link and submit their application failing which the application wont be considered :




https://morningstar.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/Americas/job/Mumbai/Data-Research-Analyst_REQ-019421





Eligibility:

Candidates who have attempted the online test for Equity role in past 6 months, wont be eligible.

60 % and above in Final year Graduation Or Post Graduation

Only Finance Graduates Or Post Graduates can apply to this role.
MBA / MMS / PGDM/ MCOM / BMS / BBA/ B&I / BCOM / A&F can apply.

Aadhar Card is mandatory for candidate registration at the time of attempting online test.

Immediate Joiners preferred.




Selection Process:

Eligible candidate will receive an email with the online test link and instructions. The candidate would be required to attempt the test as per the date and time mentioned in the email. The candidates selected in the test will undergo 3 virtual interview rounds. The online test and the interviews will happen in the month of October 2021 itself.




Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted by the recruitment team.




Date of Joining:

The expected date of joining is October 2021. We welcome candidates from diverse locations to apply since the onboarding will be virtual and selected candidates will be required to work from Morningstar office only once the Covid situation is under control.




Job Location: Vashi, Navi Mumbai




The Group:

Morningstar's Research group provides independent analysis on individual securities, funds, markets, and portfolios. The Research group also provides data on hundreds of thousands of investments offerings, including stocks, mutual funds, and similar vehicles, along with real-time global market data on millions of equities, indexes, futures, options, commodities, and precious metals, in addition to foreign exchange and Treasury markets. Morningstar is one of the largest independent sources of fund, equity, and credit data and research in the world, and our advocacy for investors interests is the foundation of our company.

The Role:

In this role you will work on collecting fundamental data from balance sheet, cash flow statement, income statement and footnotes for Global market companies as per the predefined collection policies. You will adhere to local teams goals, policies and procedures and work in a focused manner to achieve the overall organizations goals and objectives. You will be responsible for ensuring and improving the performance, productivity and efficiency and the delivery of the operational performance KPIs. You will effectively manage your performance and development in order to support our continuous operational success.

Responsibilities:

Establishing and achieving the set SMART goals with the direction of the team lead.
Have a very good understanding of the fundamental data for company's income statement, cash flow statement, balance sheet, and other fundamental data sets.

Expected candidates to be strong in Financial Accounting concepts with through understanding

Participate in the Center of Excellence initiative focused on reducing resource costs, consolidating global data collection platforms, and supporting database integration projects.

Own and Drive continuous improvement within the process through Quality initiatives.
Collecting and analyzing equity fundamentals data for Global market and taking ownership in data quality controls to ensure consistent and high quality data are manufactured in order to meet product requirements.
Manage data as per client-specific requirement, while at the same time adhering to Morningstar's set KPIs and KRAs.
Develop a thorough understanding of the various filing nomenclature of countries under coverage.
Passion for data and its impact on decision making.
Closely work with quality assurance and technical department to resolve clients data issues timely and effectively.
Actively discover and raise issues in work (including system, process, and collection methodology) and propose enhancement suggestion to further improve system functionality, process efficiency and data quality.
Participate in other data and process related projects, like industry/market data collection methodology research, market expansion, process certification, new product development support, etc.




Morningstar is an equal opportunity employer.

Job description

Job Description

Position:  Business Intelligence Analyst

Department: PitchBook

No. of position: 1

Shift : UK Shift (2:30 PM to 11:30 PM)




Title: Business Intelligence Analyst, PitchBook Data, a Morningstar company




How to Apply : Application Link (mandatory)

Candidates need to visit the below link and submit their application failing which the application wont be considered :

https://morningstar.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/Americas/job/Mumbai/Business-Intelligence-Analyst_REQ-022337-1




The Team: PitchBook Research team performs web-based research and utilizes technology tools to capture hard-to-find data on private capital markets including venture capital, private equity, and mergers and acquisitions (M&A). This information allows PitchBooks customers to discover emerging companies, conduct research on potential investment opportunities, and gain a competitive edge in investment decision-making and negotiations.




The Role: The Business Intelligence Analyst perform critical analysis and data support of all Research operations aspects across the Research function at PitchBook. The role uses data to figure out trends, perform critical analysis and build data visualizations for Research function at PitchBook. The Analyst will conduct thorough data analysis, help design and implement analytics programs, generate reports, and collaborate with various teams to ensure we are optimizing our resources and maximizing our output. The Analyst works closely with business and IT team to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions.




Responsibilities:

Work with a range of data and reporting technologies like SQL, Tableau and Power BI to help build, maintain and manage dashboards to power analytics for data-driven decision making
Design and maintain SQL views, Power BI datasets, workspaces and reporting structures used to compile insights
Build executive level reporting that displays complex quantitative data in a simple, intuitive format and to present findings in a clear and concise manner
Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources, spot trends/anomalies/outliers, synthesize raw data and create models to test hypotheses
Provide design support for development of business intelligence solutions, build an in-depth understanding of the business, and serve as the primary owner of new report requests
Interpret business requirements and determines optimum BI solutions to meet business needs
Own reporting for daily, weekly and monthly business metrics, and the responsibility to communicate results and make recommendations to senior management
Trains users and executives to use reports, metrics and action-oriented information correctly



Qualifications:

Ability to work with a range of data and reporting technologies to build upon a strong foundation of rigor, quantitative techniques and efficient processing
Bachelors degree from STEM fields such as Computer Science, Engineering, IT,  Analytics, etc. Specialized training/certification and masters degree preferred.
Intermediate SQL skills a necessity and advanced SQL preferred, with experience querying large datasets from multiple sources and developing automated reporting
R and/or Python skills for scripting, data manipulation, custom ETLs, statistical analysis
Experience with BI/data visualization software programs such as Tableau or Microsoft Power BI
Excellent analytical thinking and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate complex data issues correctly and clearly to both internal and external customers
Attention to detail. Ability to define and organize tasks, responsibilities & priorities.
Willing and flexible to work on UK shift and Indian holidays



Morningstar is an equal opportunity employer

Field3: Job description The Analytics Reporting Analyst is a Senior Associate who helps drive critical business decisions by compiling data, creating metrics and designing reports related to technology purchases of products and services that Grant Thornton uses to support the firm. The Analyst helps communicate these results to the applicable target groups, managers and provides suggestions based on findings. In addition to technical skills, the analyst must have the ability to prioritize tasks and manage time well. A successful candidate will have a strong technical education/background, have a data analytics and reporting experience, have the ability to effectively communicate cross operationally, and possess a strong attention to detail.     The duties and responsibilities of the Analytics Reporting Analyst include more than collecting and analyzing data. They also must make this data relevant and understandable to those who need the information to streamline business processes and make strategic business decisions. This analyst will also be the backup for the invoice approval process and requisition creation when needed, providing oversight to the Financial Analyst Associate. In general, the day-to-day activities of the Analytics Reporting Analyst may include the following:    Using data mining to extract information from data sets and identify correlations and patterns    Organizing and transforming information into comprehensible structures   A solid understanding of data sources, data organization and storage   Monitoring data quality and resolving data inaccuracies   Maintain databases and perform updates as necessary to ensure all details on reports are accurate and up to date   Accurately analyze and collect data for various types of business reports   Using data to predict trends in spending and performance   Creating metrics useful in running the business   Using tools and techniques to visualize data in easy-to-understand formats, such as diagrams and graphs   Preparing reports and presenting these to management, demonstrating a solid understanding and interpretation of the data   Identifying and recommending new ways improve business processes and control IT spend   Communicating with stakeholders to understand data content and business requirements   Work with Finance resources to create a monthly financial reporting package   Create business reports that provide insight into key data points   Act as backup for Business Support Manager in Invoice Approvals and Requisition Creation when needed   Business/information systems or a related field/Technology Background   3-5 Years experience in data analytics and reporting   Excellent Organizational and Planning Skills   Advanced Communication Skills (various mediums (email, conversational and written)   Advanced Microsoft Suite Skills (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint)   Advanced Excel required - understanding of pivot tables, vlookups, and complex formulas   Microsoft O365 required - Teams, Sharepoint   Experience with Visualization Tools - PowerBI (required), Tableau, Domo   Automation experience desired - Job description

Job description




Job Role: Data Engineer/ Big Data Engineer/Data Science

Location: Chennai/Bangalore/Hyderabad




Greetings from CAIA - Center for Artificial Intelligence & Advanced Analytics

43% of companies experienced a high deficit of skilled resources with Advanced Analytical skills and AI implementing capabilities in the year 2020. CAIA gives you a great opportunity to enter the world of future technologies and Innovations- Data Science, Analytics, AI, Data Visualization, and Cloud Computing.

While 2020 was a year like no other, we are living in an interesting times where data is reshaping the world, and businesses are rapidly adopting technology to gain an edge over others. Hence, there's a substantial increase in demand for technology professionals who can implement systems in data science, machine learning, and AI in Tier 1 and Tier 2 organizations working closely with us.

To help you build a sustainable career we would like you to utilize data, software and Analytical approaches in Data Science and AI to upskill and get recruited into an organization appreciating your skilling journey.


Applications invited from all Freshers and experienced candidates (0-3 yrs) aspiring to make a career in Artificial Intelligence and Advanced Analytics and Data Science.

If you wish to make a shift in your career or undergo a career transition, upskilling is essential since it allows you to learn more about the domain and acquire the required skills. We have exciting opportunities for you to explore!




Call to schedule interview Monday -Saturday from 10:00 am to 7.00 Pm




Manivannan A - + 91 8754281319

Koodesh - +91 73395 11107

Manigandan B - +91 93444 57360




Email :

manigandan@centerforaia.com

careerguidance@centerforaia.com




What is needed from you?



Freshers who wish to start their career in Analytics and AI and professionals who wish to upskill or change their domain to analytics and emerging technologies are free to apply.
Educational background in any one of the following- BE/B.Tech, ME/M Tech, MSc, BSc/MSc Math's and Statistics, B Com, BCA, BSc CS, BSC IT, MSC IT, MCA
Skills relating to Mathematics/Statistics.
Natural passion towards numbers, business, coding, Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, visualization
Good verbal and written communication skills
Ability to understand domains in businesses across various sectors



Selection procedure includes



Aptitude Test & Communication Exam - Online / Offline
SQL/Python test - Online / Offline



Candidates who clear the above will have one-one discussions with our Career Guidance Manager for further evaluation and processing of your Resume.




All the Shortlisted candidates will be eligible to continue the corporate training with CAIA

What you can expect from us?




You will get trained on the following modules for a period of 10-12 weeks:

SQL & PLSQL
Data Management Process using ETL
Data Wrangling using Python
Data Integration using -Informatica
Artificial Intelligence, Data Interpretation
Data Visualization Using Power-BI
Cloud Data Lake
Simulation Projects



Expected Outcome?




At the end of the Training you are expected to be well versed with the following:

Apply basic skills and treat data mathematically.
Use ETL process (Extract, Transform, Load) to transform and consolidate data from multiple sources
Analyze large and complex data sets from multiple sources to provide insights and validate the hypothesis
Understanding/implementation of algorithms using Python to mine targeted data and develop the ability to convert the data into a business story.
Analyze the information, identify patterns and trends to build effective dashboards.
Use data to create visually exciting, interactive, and informative Dashboards.

Field3: Job description Job Overview    The RFDAR function organization is responsible for the data and production elements of capital reporting deliverables, accountable for the accuracy and timeliness of inputs provided for reporting purposes.      The RFDP Fin Infra team is part of RFDAR with a current strength of 106. The groups within Fin Infra are          L2 Finance DMC team which monitors and coordinates strategic resolution of data validation exceptions for the core Finance applications used by downstream consumers for Balance Sheet, P&L and capital calculations and regulatory reporting.          Exposure Moves Analysis (EMA) team which validates credit risk exposure variances for daily, Weekly and monthly and adjusts exposure for regulatory RWA computation and Capital, Leverage & ICAAP reporting to PRA ,FINMA and Fed.          Scenario Exposure Analysis (SEA)function involves analysing counterparty Credit Scenario exposure moves on a monthly basis, providing commentary on valid moves & adjusting any incorrect strategically calculated exposure for submission to Financial Accounting (FA) group for both FINMA & PRA B3 reporting & for Credit Scenarios limit monitoring. Apart from this, the analysis on Scenarios RWA is used to determine the Credit Suisse s capital requirements in stress situations. This function also involves the testing & sign offs on critical exposure methodology change projects (like CCAR).           PE moves validation team is aimed to validate & explain exposure moves and breaches on daily /monthly basis and provide trend report, commentary & indicative adjustments to exposures to credit risk managers and Credit risk reporting.     Essentials Skills and Qualifications:       Graduate or Post-Graduate in Finance / Accounts / Statistics / Economics         0-3 years of work experience in a financial institution with good knowledge understanding of capital markets, accounting and    Risk management tools and techniques          Experience of working in an Investment Bank especially Capital Markets will be an added advantage.          Good knowledge of financial products across various asset classes          Sound understanding of life cycle of a trade and risk management concepts          Excellent communication skills both oral and written (interact with geographically dispersed teams).          Analytical skills to identify the scope and parameters of reported issues and provide appropriate solutions          Familiarity with process improvement tools is an advantage      Experience of data analysis using Structured Query Language (SQL) to analyze large datasets in an action-oriented environment       RoleResearch Analyst,Industry TypeIT Services & Consulting,Functional AreaBFSI, Investments & Trading,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryTrading, Asset & Wealth ManagementEducationUG :Any GraduatePG :Post Graduation Not RequiredKey SkillsData analysisData validationProcess improvementRisk AnalystAnalyst 1Risk managementBalance SheetFinancial servicesMonitoringSQL

Field1: Business Finance AnalystUrbanClap3.5(220 Reviews)Send me jobs like thisApply
Field3: Job description   Brief         The candidate will be working as part of the Finance team @ Urban Company and will be expected to perform the key task of aligning and automating Financial reporting needs between Finance, Analytics, and various Business Units/departments.      About Urban Company:     Home services is a large, unorganized industry in India. Indian consumers spend ~ USD 30 Billion annually on home services. They largely rely on word of mouth and friends-family recommendations for search and discovery. There is no large, well run, billion-dollar Company in this category today. The industry lacks scale benefits - standardization, transparency, and trust.     In the absence of organized players, the current market architecture is froth with middlemen and aggregators, who control market access and keep a lion s share of the margins. As a result, experiences are broken for both customers and end service professionals. The industry could easily be 1.5-2x larger than it is today if frictions in transaction journeys are removed - and experiences made more meaningful and memorable   .     What are you expected to do         Primary tasks:         1. Developing SQL/Redash/Looker queries for preparation of key Finance deliverables like Monthly MIS reports, Budgeted vs Actual performance analysis, City level financial and business analysis, Trending forecasts, AOP, etc.     2. Developing queries to enable recording, presentation, and automation of new PL line items into regular MIS reports, which may come up with new business initiatives / internal process re-alignments.     3. Working with different departments within the organization (SCM, HR, Quality, Operations, Marketing) to understand their key reporting requirements, and suggesting best ways to present data for everyday tracking and business performance reporting (using both graphical and tabular reports).     4. Developing Tableau Dashboards from scratch-     a. Defining reporting requirements with departmental HODs / FPA Lead, and marrying the same with org. reporting needs     b. Recommending ways to present data on Tableau and finalizing reporting formats     c. Setting up internal processes with Analytics team to ensure collection and update of data on dashboard created     d. Continuous improvement based on evolving needs of org/department     5. The employee will work with both Business Finance and Core Finance teams from time to time. However, primary reporting shall rest within Business Finance.     Additional tasks (that shall come up as the employee grows into his/her role):     5. Assisting Business Finance Managers / Leaders with the key analysis of critical business parameters from time to time, as well as on adhoc basis (based on requirement).     6. Generating insights into and providing recommendations on improving Business Performance.     7. Regularly coordinating with key stakeholders to update and improve upon the existing business metrics derived from Redash/ Tableau, and leading projects proactively to improve overall financial reporting analysis.        What are we looking for      1.    Experience in Business Analytics / Data analysis / Data intelligence.      2. Should have good knowledge of Redash, Tableau, SQL, VBA, and MS Excel.      3. Should be from an IT background but having exposure in a Business Analyst/Financial Analyst/Data analyst role in the past.      4. Should have worked on Tableau Dashboard development in the past.      5. Should be professional and confident enough to work directly on projects with top management.      6. Smart and responsible individual with high integrity, ownership, and a willingness to grow.         Skills Required: MS Excel, SQL, Tableau, Basic finance concepts (mandatory); VBA, R, Python (preferred)      RoleFinancial Analyst,Industry TypeIT Services & Consulting,Functional AreaFinance & Accounting,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryFinanceEducationUG :Any GraduatePG :Any PostgraduateKey SkillsData analysisAutomationFinancial reportingBusiness analysisBusiness analyticsOracle ERPSCMContinuous improvementSQLPython

The Sr.Software Engineer , DVC is an emerging role in Ralph Lauren s DVC Data team and will play a pivotal role in delivering insights for the most critical data and analytics initiatives for Ralph Lauren.    The software engineer is responsible for software design, development and deployment on Microsoft stack of SQL Server, SSIS, .NET, C#, Power BI.   Well conversant with Azure services to deliver software on cloud platform.     Enforce organizational and operational development standards through governance mechanisms that include the creation, communication and dispensation of standards and procedures.Writing code and documenting solutions.    It is expected that the software engineer collaborate with line of business users, business analysts, and data analysts and should be able to perform the tasks involved in the role with limited assistance from peers, and vendor support services. Field3:
Job description

If you can solve a Rubik's cube, spent hours playing with Lego or ever built a new world in Minecraft, you could be the type of Data Engineer we need.

Webhelp is recruiting an analytical thinker with that wow factor to join our team in Hyderabad to support developing modern data warehouse solutions using Azure Stack, as well as designing information systems and work-flow diagrams.

If you have the drive to and create innovative big data solutions to drive revenue through a technology enabled strategy then don't miss this opportunity and apply today.

What you'll be doing
- Designing, implementing, and supporting key datasets that provide structured and timely access to actionable business information with the needs of the end customer always in view
- Retrieving and analysing data using SQL, Excel, and other data management systems
- Creating ETLs/ELTs to take data from various operational systems and craft a unified dimensional or star schema data model for analytics and reporting
- Developing a deep understanding of vast data sources (existing on the cloud) and know exactly how, when, and which data to use to solve particular business problems
- Creating data tools and web/digital/mobile applications for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimising our analytics, including deployment into operations and client systems
- Assembling large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements
- Identifying, designing, and implementing internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimising data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
- Building the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL, Azure and the continually emerging big data technologies
- Embedding processes to ensure we regularly check and improve data quality of our core analytics data sources and warehouse
- Assisting with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs
- Creating and maintaining optimal data pipeline architecture and work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems
- Building analytics tools that utilise the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer experience, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics

What you'll need
- Minimum 5 years' of experience in a Data Engineer role with detailed knowledge of data warehouse technical architectures, ETL/ ELT, reporting/analytic tool, data security, Onion, Repository, Builder, MVC, Faade, Factory or Singleton
- Knowledge of ASP.Net, C#.NET, LINQ, JQuery, Java Script, Angular DataTables, Ajax, XML, Web Services and Web API
- Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field
- Experience leading and designing data warehousing and analytics project infrastructure, and integrating technical components including using Azure
- Experience with production BI implementation in the Cloud
- Exposure to reporting tools such as Qlikview or Power BI (Desirable)
- Hands-on expertise with application design, software development and automated testing, preferably in a mobile/digital space
- Ability to effectively interpret technical and business objectives and challenges, and articulate solutions
- Experience building and optimising big data pipelines, architectures and data sets

After applying, you will be sent a link to complete a quick online chat. We don't want you to miss out on the opportunity so please check all of folders for the link after applying. Take this opportunity to join our collaborative team of game-changers today.

Job description

To support our growth, we seek an entry level Energy markets analyst to work in our Wholesale Power line of business. He/she will contribute to the development of innovative, accurate, timely, and high quality products and services, typically working on multiple projects with all levels of staff. Energy markets analyst at ICF have an opportunity to apply their experience and academic knowledge, gain exposure to major projects, and interact with experts and clients in the field, while building content knowledge and consulting skills. He/she advance in our consulting practice and develop an area of special competence, with increasing responsibility for project management and client contact.

Key Responsibilities

Perform advanced quantitative and economic analysis of energy markets globally, but with a focus on North America, to assess and forecast the future of electric power and fuels markets, prices, power plant operation and valuation, fuel consumption, environmental emissions and compliance, transmission, regulatory effects, among other parameters
Extensive data research. Responsible for maintaining a large database of energy related data that must be updated regularly. Data sources include data-providers, industry publications, regulatory agencies and web research.
Tracking of up to date information on energy sector (particularly generation, transmission and distribution) and incorporating in existing industry databases
Creation of new industry databases that may be required
Exhaustive analysis of forecast and changes resulting from updated inputs
Interface with clients on key deliverables
Prepares documents and summaries for submission to clients
Prepares papers and presentations for external publications

Basic Qualifications:

Master's Degree in an engineering preferably electrical & mechanical
0-3 years of relevant energy industry experience
Ability to demonstrated quantitative skills
Microsoft Office Suite (PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Outlook, Access

Preferred Skills/Experience:

Power market experience
Knowledge of linear optimization / production cost models / applied microeconomics is an advantage Previous consulting experience
Strong modeling skills specifically advanced Microsoft excel skill

Professional Skills

Owns The Business:

Builds knowledge of the business and applies understanding of ICF markets and capabilities to day-to-day responsibilities. Aligns with and supports decisions.
Sets challenging and measurable and sustainable goals in collaboration with manager(s).
Makes understanding and meeting client needs a driving force behind daily work.

Builds Organizational Capability:

Builds one’s own skills and abilities for the future.
Recognizes and supports the need for change. Adopts new system and processes to support evolving business needs.
Models Leadership:
Recognizes own strengths, limitations and personal motivations.
Demonstrates trustworthiness and upholds the highest ethical standards.
Cooperates with others and values diversity.
Ensures that information flows effectively to others.

Analytical Ability:

Identifies and collects the information needed to solve a problem effectively.
Acknowledges when one doesn’t know something and takes steps to find out

Written Communication & Presentation Skills:

Clearly expresses ideas, thoughts, and concepts in writing.
Organizes written work in a manner that is clear, easy to follow, and tailored for the intended audience.
Effectively communicates information and ideas using speech and visual aids.
Effectively organizes ideas for logical presentation and maximum impact.

Job description

If you're someone who values order and structure then Webhelp has the ideal opportunity for you to step into a new role as a Process Assurance Analyst at our offices in Gurgaon.

You will assess and analyse process adherence from various data sources including customer interactions to provide recommendations and visibility of risk to key stakeholders, reducing the financial and brand exposure risk.

In addition, you will investigate, promote and implement new ideas and initiatives in terms of quality improvement that will support the operations department to ensure a competitive edge within the outsourcing marketplace.

What you'll be doing
- Providing daily, weekly and monthly Quality reports including completion, gap analysis, result trends, trend benchmarking and performance management trends to meet stakeholder requirements
- Focusing on various aspects of reporting such as live dashboards, new tool knowledge, insights etc.
- Providing advice and guidance regarding reporting queries including initial interpretation of the quality rules and conflicts of interest policies against specific query related facts and the development of initial advice on matters under review
- Working with relevant internal and external stakeholders to ensure data is accurate and current as well as working towards continually improving the process of data reporting, analysis and insight
- Identifying opportunities for process improvement, working with Line Manager on the implementation of new/updated processes
- Developing and implementing reporting tools to support business requirements

What you'll need
- Proven experience with Power BI, MS Office 365, SharePoint, Power Apps, Power Automate and One Drive
- Advanced MS Excel experience including formulae, pivots, lookups, reports, etc.
- High level of numerical literacy and data analysis methods including correlation, causation, regression analysis, data visualisation and standard deviation for CSAT, NPS, FCR, AHT calculations to provide customer outcome results
- Expertise in preparing performance dashboards, charts and dynamic reports at management level and above including strategy and business case scenarios
- Good knowledge of VBA including userforms, loops, sub routines, UDFs, Array, etc.
- Producing actionable insight and recommendations
- Good knowledge of Power Pivot, Power Query, DAX and data modelling
- Excellent communication skills, ability to interact with self-confidence at all levels, as well as managing key stakeholder relationships

Field3: Job description   About You    As an Ongoing Monitoring Analyst, you would be working on being the first line of defence in our battle against financial crime. You ll be responsible for monitoring a variety of transaction types across our customer base. This role is an important part of our monitoring and helps identify any suspicious activity that requires firther investigation.    You ll be entrepreneurial and an expert within a marketplace business, someone who is very familiar with the dynamics of marketplace platforms. You ll also have the seniority and experience to build a team. A unique role, you ll be able to bring the vision to life whilst playing a leading role within Tide s product team. Working alongside experienced product professionals and hand-in-hand with senior developers, data scientists, designers, and marketers to research, build, ship and improve the product.     Some of the things you ll be doing:     Analyzing transactions across a variety of payment types to look for signs of financial crime including money laundering and terrorist financing     Sanctioning and screening some payments     Developing and seeking ways to improve tools and process for transaction analysis     Reviewing transaction alerts, spotting inconsistencies and escalating accounts with financial crime concerns.     Using a variety of tools to analyse transactions in different ways, including thematic reviews, responsible for different operational activities as per requirements     Working a shared shift pattern     Willing to work weekends as and when required     What you ll get in return:      Competitive salary       Health Insurance, Life insurance and Accident insurance       25 days annual leaves       Enhanced family-friendly leave       Dental Benefit       Learning Development Budget      You ll be a great fit if:     You have a good eye for detail to be able to identify suspicious activity amongst transaction data     You have 2+ years of experience working in AML and transaction monitoring in India, preferably in a highly regulated environment     You have strong understanding and experience of CDD and EDD processes in Indian context     You have professional work experience, preferably in financial services e.g. Banking sector and Fintech     You have inclination towards asking right questions with problem solving attitude and always looking to make process leaner and robust     You have an analytical mind able to digest large data sets and spot patterns and trends with ease     You are a quick learner, explorer, multitasker and flexible with work profile     You have exceptional communication skills written and verbal to communicate with the clients and company stakeholders regulatory bodies if required       RoleFinance Executive,Industry TypeIT Services & Consulting,Functional AreaFinance & Accounting,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryFinanceEducationUG :Any GraduatePG :Any PostgraduateKey SkillsTransaction MonitoringAmlCommunication SkillsFinancial ServicesFinanceBankingTransaction AnalysisProblem SolvingWork From

Job description

Data Scientist/ Machine Learning Engineer




Various locations.


Description


Primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, build recommendation systems to drastically improve on our cross-selling capabilities, build credit score models that will help us assess customer risk, and build systems for automated fraud detection
Provide analytic support to the business teams by understanding the context and formulate/execute appropriate analytical approach to address the situation
This will be a high visibility role that will entail working closely with the Senior Management and several functions. The team member should independently manage end-to-end partner communication



Core Responsibilities



Development and maintenance of statistical / quantitative models and segmentations
Ability to manage & develop analytic solutions to deliver on complex projects
Using insights from data, to improve cross-sell capabilities to BankBazaars past customers & visitors; How to increase customer LTV (Lifetime value) and repeat purchase behavior
Measure & own the business impact of work, Set and manage partner expectations, manage timeliness around project priorities
Can coach/mentor junior team members on theory/practical applications of relevant tools & techniques, significantly contribute to the standardization and best practices



Qualifications


Preferable to have Masters in a numerate subject such as Mathematics, Operational Research, Business Administration, Economics etc. from a premier institute / Bachelors with a track record of performance that demonstrates the ability of understanding numbers
Added advantage: Have worked in any of the following domain: (Credit Cards, Retail Bank, Mortgage, Lending/Liability Product)
Proficient in formulating analytical methodology, identifying trends and patterns with data
Expertise in advanced statistics including hypothesis testing, regression, segmentation, text mining and neural networks, optimization and forecasting
Proficient in tools like MS Excel, PowerPoint and programming language such as R, SAS, SQL, Python; familiarity with PowerBI is an added advantage
Good to have expertise in Adobe Site Catalyst/Omniture/Google Analytics
Solid communication skills: Demonstrated ability to explain complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences, Capability to act as an owner & deliver results

Sal is best in Industry.

Field3: Job description As a Compliance Analyst at Tide, you ll join an ambitious team of highly motivated, talented Tideans who love to collaborate and are driven by helping people achieve their business ambitions. Tide s compliance team plays a vital role in managing the business risks and ensuring we comply with all applicable regulatory and best practices requirements. You ll provide assistance to the Compliance team in several tasks and have a lot of exposure to different projects across the business. You ll be able to work in a fast-paced environment, with cross-team exposure, inquisitive freedom and the ability to have a real impact on the way Tide conducts its business.      You ll be entrepreneurial and an expert within a marketplace business, someone who is very familiar with the dynamics of marketplace platforms. You ll also have the seniority and experience to build a team. A unique role, you ll be able to bring the vision to life whilst playing a leading role within Tide s product team. Working alongside experienced product professionals and hand-in-hand with senior developers, data scientists, designers, and marketers to research, build, ship and improve the product.      Some of the things you ll be doing:        Assisting in the execution of the compliance monitoring plan, undertake some of the monitoring and actions or engage others where necessary.        Researching regulatory changes and helping assess impact to Tide.        Working with business areas to research regulatory requirements in support of product development.        Keeping policies across the business up to date and tracking where refreshers are required.        Tracking and record audit findings and subsequent actions.        Maintaining the risk register with respective risk areas.        Maintaining incident management and FCA Communication logs.        Providing MI to our partners where required and liaison point for our partners with oversight requests.         Tracking FCA deadlines, filing FCA submissions, maintaining a log of FCA contact, helping prepare for FCA meetings and visits.        Supporting the Risk and Compliance committee.        Logging training internally and coordinating risk and compliance-related training.       What you ll get in return:        Competitive salary        Health Insurance, Life insurance and Accident insurance        25 days annual leaves        Enhanced family-friendly leave        Dental Benefit        Learning Development Budget       You ll be a great fit if:        You have at least 1 year of experience working in a Compliance/Risk role.        You have up to date knowledge on FCA and AML/KYC regulations and guidelines. Previous experience with PSD2 regulations and guidelines will be an advantage.        You are  comfortable interpreting regulations and knowing where to search for regulation.        You have a can-do, firm and proactive attitude. You ll often be required to interact directly with other teams to chase/monitor on internal requests and demands.         You are  highly organized and able to prioritize workload working to tight deadlines           RoleBusiness Analyst,Industry TypeIT Services & Consulting,Functional AreaData Science & Analytics,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryBusiness Intelligence & AnalyticsEducationUG :Any GraduatePG :Any PostgraduateKey SkillsReturnsComplianceLife InsuranceFinanceBankingWork FromAccounts

Field1: Operations Performance AnalystWebhelp4.1(145 Reviews)Send me jobs like thisApply
Field3:
Job description

Are you a passionate, observant and highly organized perfectionist? If you're someone who values order and structure then Webhelp has the ideal opportunity for you to step into a new role as an Operational Performance Analyst at our offices in Gurgaon.

You will assess and analyze process adherence from various data sources including customer interactions to provide recommendations and visibility of risk to key stakeholders, reducing the financial and brand exposure risk. You should be willing work in 24/7 rotational shifts environment.

If you're ready to take on a new challenge then apply today.

What you'll be doing
- Providing daily, weekly and monthly Quality reporting including completion, gap analysis, result trends, trend benchmarking and reporting on performance management trends to meet stakeholder requirements
- Directing the preparation and maintenance of such reports as are necessary to carry out the functions of the department
- Preparing periodic reports for management track strategic goal accomplishment
- Focusing on various aspects of reporting like incentives, Live Dashboards, new tool knowledge and insights
- Providing advice and guidance regarding reporting queries submitted by the operations
- Working with relevant internal and external stakeholders to ensure data is accurate and current
- Collaborating with the wider team to assist with any client requirements when necessary to provide advice and support on data and strategies
- Work closely with all stakeholders to define and maintain reporting requirements across all Webhelp sites and to continually improve the process of data reporting, analysis and insights
- Investigating, promoting and implementing new ideas and initiatives in terms of quality improvement that will support the operations department thus maintaining the competitive edge within the outsourcing marketplace
- Reporting and analyzing key performance metrics for daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual requirements
- Assisting with analysis in discrepancies within reporting suite to ensure all reporting is fully up-to date and accurate
- Identifying process improvement opportunities, working with line manager on the implementation of new/updated processes
- Developing and implementing of reporting tools to support business requirements

What you'll need
- Proven experience with Power BI, MS Office 365, SharePoint, Power Apps, Power Automate and One Drive
- Advanced MS Excel experience including formulae, pivots, lookups and reports
- High level of numerical literacy and data analysis methods including correlation, causation, regression analysis, data visualization and standard deviation for CSAT, NPS, FCR, AHT calculations to provide customer outcome results
- Expertise in preparing performance dashboards, charts and dynamic reports at management level and above including strategy and business case scenarios
- Good knowledge of VBA including user forms, loops, sub routines, UDFs, Array, etc.
- Producing actionable insight and recommendations
- Good knowledge of Power Pivot, Power Query, DAX and data modelling
- Excellent communication skills and ability to manage key stakeholder relationships
- Availability to work 24/7 on a rotational basis

After applying, you will be sent a link to complete a quick online chat. We don't want you to miss out on the opportunity so please check all of folders for the link after applying. Take this opportunity advance your career with our collaborative team of game-changers.

Field3: Job description      Description:      The Data Steward role is part of the Master Data team and is responsible for key data quality initiatives and maintenance activities focused on certain vital data points including Product and Customer Hierarchy maintenance. These initiatives have significant impacts on enterprise data that flows across various Order-to-Cash and CRM systems as well as the enterprise data warehouse.       Responsibilities:     Assists in creating, documenting and adhering to consistent data maintenance procedures for key data points across all strategic business units (SBUs) within Clarivate Analytics   Maintain focus on a minimum set of data points that are highly used and vital to billing, marketing, sales, financial reporting activities   Be knowledgeable about business processes and master systems of all SBUs within Clarivate Analytics without showing preference or deference to any one particular business   Work with the business to define standards and rules to ensure customer master data is compliant with defined information, policies and quality requirements.   Manage the workflow task process for new data requests, changes, and deletions and entering (create / change / delete) data   Conduct primarily online research on customer and prospect records to validate and/or enhance internal data where applicable/useful   Closely interact with business and provide master data subject matter expert input to various project teams as it relates to customer master data management and enterprise-level data governance   Identify and execute robust and continuous improvement opportunities within the data management processes in the applicable source systems   Identify missing or incorrect master data standards   Generate master data reporting such as key metrics, project trackers, and dashboards on a regular basis   Ensure the data quality within and initiate the appropriate corrective actions or applicable escalation help chains to enable success       Qualifications/Experience:     Any Graduate or Post graduate - Any Specialization; preferably Post graduate   0-2 years Data analysis/customer/product master maintenance experience   Advanced Excel skills; VBA/Macro writing experience a plus   Strong general research searching skills   Experience with data validation   Strong analytical skills, with high attention to detail and data accuracy   Strong communication skills (oral and written)   Salesforce.com, SAP Customer Master experience a plus   Ability to work independently and as part of a team   Ability to remain engaged in and focused on repetitive tasks covering the same set of data points     RoleDatabase Architect / Designer,Industry TypeIT Services & Consulting,Functional AreaEngineering - Software,Employment TypeFull Time, PermanentRole CategoryDBA / Data warehousingEducationUG :Any GraduatePG :Post Graduation Not RequiredKey SkillsData analysisSAPData managementFinancial reportingBillingIntellectual propertyWorkflowContinuous improvementAnalyticsCRM

Employment_type:
Analyst - I-Alpha (IITns, CS, Mathematics & Scientific Computing)

Work Experience: 0-3 years

Responsibilities:

- Design and implement mathematical models for fundamental valuation of securities. The person will need to understand latest research in quantitative finance and implement the same.

- Design, back-testing and implementation of high-frequency trading strategies on international exchanges. Work as part of the market-making team to determine the signals and trading strategies to go live with.

- Conduct performance attribution of live portfolios.

Required Skills:

- Strong candidates should have 0-3 years of work experience and successful track record in quantitative analysis preferably in the capital markets domain.

- Post-Graduate degree in statistics, finance, mathematics, engineering (Computer Science preferred) or other quantitative or computational disciplines

- Experience in using some or all of the following packages: R, MATLAB, SPSS, CART, C# .Net

- Good written and oral communication skills.

- Strong experience working both independently and in a team-oriented collaborative environment.

- Entrepreneurial, self-motivated individual - high energy, high activity levels - passion for working with an innovative, small but rapidly growing company.

Employment_type:
Designation - Business Intelligence Engineer

Reporting to - CTO

Your responsibilities would include :

- Work with cross-functional user teams / Stakeholders to determine the metrics, reports, and analyses needed for decision-making.

- Retrieve and analyze data using SQL and/or other data management systems

- Develop queries for ad hoc requests and projects, as well as ongoing reporting.

- Monitor existing metrics, analyze data, and partner with other internal teams to identify and implement process and system improvements

- Design and support key datasets that provide structured and timely access to actionable business information with the needs of the end user always in view

- Present Data Insights to non-technical team members as well as technical team members using PPT or Reporting Dashboards.

- Work closely with Product team and stakeholders to guide product priorities based on Data available

The qualities we are looking for are :

- Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics or other quantitative discipline.

- Strong Experience in writing SQL queries and understanding of RDBMS System.

- Familiarity with theory and practice of statistics, information retrieval and data mining.

- Experience in scripting for automation (e.g. Python, Ruby, Perl).

- Experience using statistical packages and business intelligence tools such as R, Python etc.

- Experience in building dashboards and reports to surface business intelligence data.

- Knowledge of visualization platforms is a Plus

- Strong analytical and excellent problem solving skills.

- Proven interpersonal skills. Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.

- Strong written and verbal skills - ability to present thoughts clearly in both verbal and written form to large cross-functional teams of technical and non-technical members and across hierarchy.

- Strong desire to push ideas into production

- Ability to deal with ambiguity and shifting priorities

Nice to have :

- Experience with R-shiny or Metabase, Mixpanel

- Experience with Postgresql & Query Optimization

- Understanding or experience with Google Analytics & Firebase would be a plus

- You- ve been working in self directed side projects

- Familiar with theory and practice of machine learning

What's In for you?

- You will play an important role in our growth story.

- Look forward to an attractive compensation & a great work environment (Fun workshops, Outings & More).

- You will be working together with the best brains of the industry & learn about various areas of online marketing. & Of course, you enjoy the freedom to execute your own ideas!

Job Role: Data Processing Analyst




Job Location: Chennai, Porur (Currently Work From Home)

Year of Passing: 2019, 2020 & 2021




CTC: 3.6LPA (All Fixed)




Date of Joining: Immediate




Interview Process:




1. Please fill the link mentioned below with proper details. Registered applicants alone will be considered for further process. Only 1 response can be submitted. Edit response is not available. Make sure you fill with utmost care




https://forms.gle/7ApT4Y8E2d8WxuGL7




2. Online Assessment - Aptitude test contains Verbal reasoning, Numerical reasoning, logical reasoning, basic Excel and PowerPoint




3. Test cleared students will be called for Group Discussion (Through Google Meet)




4. Group Discussion cleared students will be having final round discussion with hiring managers (Through Google Meet)




5. Documentation collection and Offer release




For any details Please contact: Ayesha HR - ayesha.anjum@nielseniq.com


ABOUT THIS JOB
The Data Processing Specialist is responsible for instructions of client deliverables, coding and data validation focusing on specific industry / category or set of categories. As Data Processing Specialist at Nielsen, you have to create and deliver client outputs in a correct and timely manner.


RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for the execution of client instructions and client requests
Accountable for the quality and timeliness of database delivery to clients
Work with clients to complete day-to-day BAU activities.
Coordinate process and delivery handoffs with Operations teams to meet established
deliverables; escalate issues appropriately.
Collaborate with and support offshore teams to troubleshoot and ensure that deliverables are
met.

Eligibility:
Bachelors Any Graduate, Bachelor of Science/Computer Science/ Business Information
Systems or IT, BBA, B.com, or equivalent.
Fresh graduates are encouraged to apply
Excellent organization skills, aptitude to work in team and meet deadlines
A high degree of accuracy, proactivity and attention to detail
Good analytics skills and aptitude for data and operational processes
Project management aptitude (critical path, task sequencing, problem solving, etc.)
Common business language knowledge (English): speaking and writing with fluency.

Seeks essential knowledge of industry trends, competitor products, and advances in various engineering fields from publicly available information; shows interest in a specific area of expertise   Assists in conducting specialized analyses (e.g., feasibility studies, signal integrity, power integrity, teardown analyses) under the direction of more experienced engineers. Provides design solutions to evaluate, characterize and develop the design implementation solution for leading-edge products in the most advanced processes.    Interfaces with various cross functional teams (RF, Analog and Digital IC designers, Software, System Engineering, Test Engineers, Customer Engineering, and Operations) to drive and incorporate the latest design solutions in the production program to improve yield, productivity, and quality. YOUR ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Business Management Trainees/ Coops will work closely with various committee members and clients. You will be instrumental in understanding their business processes, architecture, tangible and intangible goals, and long-term visions. You will have the opportunity to learn new skills, the latest business concepts, crucial and key processes, and business transformation strategies. You will experience working in challenging environments and competitive workgroups. These entry-level positions will attract up to 5 lakh Rupees CTC after Six(6) months of Co-Op training. Depending on a good performance, there is a possibility of promotion to an entry-level position before the Six months Coop.

Plan, design, and support client meetings and stakeholder events, and workshops interviews 
Gather requirements from the potential leads and product owner
Develop first level mapping constructs of As-Is (present state) and To-Be (future state) scenario
Interpret and present generic client requirements into more analytical specifications and representations

     Drive Public relationships initiatives and management.
Brand Strategy, Design, Management, and Control

Must demonstrate creative, analytical, and logical skills
Must be able to multitask and collaborate as a great team member 
Must understand the importance of deadlines and corporate responsibilities and work ethics 
Be very motivated and positive in driving work forward.
